publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-417 Jamie McGrigor: Congratulations to Moira Cameron on Becoming the First Female Beefeater—That the Parliament congratulates Moira Cameron from Argyll on becoming the first female Beefeater ever to take up official duty at the Tower of London; notes that by becoming the first female yeoman warder since the Beefeaters’ origin in the 15th century Ms Cameron has achieved another victory for women’s rights; welcomes the fact that a Scottish woman has made history in an institution that is of such huge value to the history, culture and tourism sector of the United Kingdom, and wishes Ms Cameron a lengthy and successful career at the Tower of London. Supported by: Jamie Stone*, John Lamont*, Alex Johnstone*, Mary Scanlon*, Karen Gillon*, Elizabeth Smith*, Robin Harper*, Nanette Milne*, Bashir Ahmad*, Hugh Henry*, Murdo Fraser*, Bill Aitken*, Margaret Mitchell*
S3M-417 Congratulations to Moira Cameron on Becoming the First Female Beefeater (lodged on 5 September 2007) John Scott*, Kenneth Gibson*

S3M-417 Jamie McGrigor: Congratulations to Moira Cameron on Becoming the First Female Beefeater—That the Parliament congratulates Moira Cameron from Argyll on becoming the first female Beefeater ever to take up official duty at the Tower of London; notes that by becoming the first female yeoman warder since the Beefeaters’ origin in the 15th century Ms Cameron has achieved another victory for women’s rights; welcomes the fact that a Scottish woman has made history in an institution that is of such huge value to the history, culture and tourism sector of the United Kingdom, and wishes Ms Cameron a lengthy and successful career at the Tower of London. Supported by: Jamie Stone, John Lamont, Alex Johnstone, Mary Scanlon, Karen Gillon, Elizabeth Smith, Robin Harper, Nanette Milne, Bashir Ahmad, Hugh Henry, Murdo Fraser, Bill Aitken, Margaret Mitchell, John Scott, Kenneth Gibson
S3M-417 Congratulations to Moira Cameron on Becoming the First Female Beefeater (lodged on 5 September 2007) Ted Brocklebank*
